results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Child Abuse and Neglect;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Pascual-Reyes, Jose Paulino;Dadeville (Ala)
results.byline: By McKenna Oxenden and Michael Levenson
results.title: Girl, 12, Escapes Captivity, Leading Alabama Authorities to Find 2 Bodies
results.abstract: José Paulino Pascual-Reyes, 37, was charged with capital murder and first-degree kidnapping after the authorities said they found two decomposing bodies inside his house.

media.caption: “She’s a hero,” Sheriff Jimmy Abbett of Tallapoosa County, Ala., said of a 12-year-old girl who had managed to escape from captivity. “She’s safe and we want to keep her that way.”

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);Text Messaging;Conspiracy Theories;Jones, Alex (1974- );Heslin, Neil;Lewis, Scarlett;Infowars;Austin (Tex)
results.title: Alex Jones, Under Questioning, Is Confronted With Evidence of Deception
results.abstract: The Infowars conspiracy theorist was presented with text messages from his own cellphone that his lawyers appeared to have accidentally sent to lawyers for Sandy Hook parents.

media.caption: The conspiracy theorist Alex Jones being cross-examined during a trial in Austin, Texas, on Wednesday. “You know what perjury is, right?” the Sandy Hook parents’ lawyer, Mark Bankston, asked him.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Deaths (Fatalities);Traffic Accidents and Safety;Walorski, Jackie;House of Representatives;Indiana
results.title: Jackie Walorski, Indiana Congresswoman, Is Killed in Car Crash
results.abstract: Ms. Walorski, 58, was first elected to Congress in 2012. She was traveling in her district with two aides, who were also killed.

media.caption: Representative Jackie Walorski served as the top Republican on the House Ethics Committee.
media.copyright: Elizabeth D. Herman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Referendums;Politics and Government;States (US);Constitutional Amendments;Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Midterm Elections (2022);Kansas
results.byline: By Mitch Smith and Katie Glueck
results.title: Kansas Votes to Preserve Abortion Rights Protections in Its Constitution
results.abstract: In the first election test after the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, voters overwhelmingly rejected an amendment that would have allowed legislators to enact abortion restrictions.

media.caption: Celebrating in Overland Park, Kan., on Tuesday night after voters rejected a referendum that could have led to the restriction of abortion rights.
media.copyright: Arin Yoon for The New York Times

results.byline: By Maggie Astor and Nate Cohn
results.title: Here’s how abortion rights supporters won in conservative Kansas.
results.abstract: Turnout was high for a referendum that drew national attention.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Parenting;Actors and Actresses;Cosgrove, Miranda;Grande, Ariana;McCurdy, Jennette (1992- );Nickelodeon
results.title: Jennette McCurdy Is Ready to Move Forward, and to Look Back
results.abstract: In her memoir, “I’m Glad My Mom Died,” McCurdy, best known for her role in“iCarly,” reflects on her time as a child actor and on her troubled relationship with her mother.

media.caption: Jennette McCurdy’s relationship with her mother is the narrative force at the center of her memoir: “It’s the heartbeat of my life.”
media.copyright: Ahmed Gaber for The New York Times

results.title: A ‘Reversible’ Form of Death? Scientists Revive Cells in Dead Pigs’ Organs.
results.abstract: Researchers who previously revived some brain cells in dead pigs succeeded in repeating the process in more organs.

media.caption: Researchers said they hoped to increase the supply of human organs for transplant by allowing doctors to obtain viable organs long after death.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);United States Politics and Government;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Electoral College;Politics and Government;Ward, Kelli (1969- );Townsend, Kelly (1968- );Chesebro, Kenneth;Giuliani, Rudolph W;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Arizona
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Luke Broadwater
results.title: Arizona Officials Warned Fake Electors Plan Could ‘Appear Treasonous’
results.abstract: Politicians involved in Donald Trump’s effort to put forth electors to falsely claim he had won Arizona said doing so without first filing a legal challenge could look like a crime.

media.caption: Kelli Ward, the chairwoman of the Arizona Republican Party, joined an effort to claim former President Donald J. Trump had won the state’s 11 Electoral College votes after expressing concerns.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Your Bedroom Is on the Ballot’: How Democrats See Abortion Politics After Kansas
results.abstract: After a broad victory in a deep-red state, Democrats are vowing to elevate the fight over abortion rights in midterm races across the country.

results.title: ‘I Want You to Hear This’: A Sandy Hook Mother Confronts Alex Jones
results.abstract: Scarlett Lewis, whose son Jesse, 6, was killed in the elementary school shooting, rebuked the Infowars fabulist over his lies in a face-to-face courtroom confrontation.

media.caption: A picture of Jesse Lewis that his mother, Scarlett Lewis, keeps at her home in Newtown, Conn. Jesse is buried in the cemetery down the street.

results.title: How the C.I.A. Tracked the Leader of Al Qaeda
results.abstract: The U.S. search for Ayman al-Zawahri had spanned decades. His presence on a balcony at a safe house in Kabul presented an opportunity to strike.

media.caption: Ayman al-Zawahri, left, listening to Osama bin Laden during a news conference in Khost, Afghanistan, in 1998. Al-Zawahri became Al Qaeda’s leader after Bin Laden’s death.

results.abstract: Here is what experts say about how the virus is transmitted during everyday interactions — and which behaviors carry the most risk.

results.title: Vin Scully, Voice of the Dodgers for 67 Years, Dies at 94
results.abstract: The team has had many great players since World War II, but it was Mr. Scully, a gifted storyteller and a master of the graceful phrase, who became the enduring face of the franchise.

media.caption: Vin Scully at Shea Stadium in Queens before the start of the 2006 National League division series between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the Mets. Mr. Scully broadcast Dodger games for 67 years.
media.copyright: Andrew Gombert for The New York Times

results.title: Big Trouble in Little Loving County, Texas
results.abstract: Murdered cattle. Family feuds. People arrested showing up for jury duty. In America’s least populated county, a bare-knuckle struggle for control may hold implications for voters in the rest of Texas.
